full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/29/2023 INSTRUCTIONS On line 4, if entry was without inspection, strike out the printed language and insert E. W. 1., at port or nearest point of entry and date, i.e. "E. W. I. 2 mi. east ELP 5-6-60". If entry was as a crewman insert status of admission; vessel, date and place of arrival and date and place of desertion, i.e. "D-1 SS Cosmic NYC 3/12/61 - Deserted BAL 3/20/61". On lines 8 and 9, if alien is in possession of document other than a visa, insert type, number, place and date of issuance, i.e. "BCC # 138965 ELP 5-15-60". Give careful attention to the data reported in the Narrative. Include date, exact time and place, and manner of entry. If assistance rendered, furnish full details. Furnish circumstances of arrest if not routine. State details of travel while in the U. S. including all pertinent intelligence information. Status at entry, status when found, and length of time illegally in the U. S. shall conform to those categories under Parts I, II and III, Form G-23.12. Use code word for deportation charges. In interview cases furnish full details as to health, humanitarian aspects, and the information required in G-135 block below. Furnish information copy to appropriate CPI and/or DD when required by O.I. 103.1(a) and 103.1(b). If an alien has claimed U. S. citizenship or prosecution is contemplated, fill out form I-215a. If an alien is required to be registered, check the block marked "Alien Registration." NARRATIVE (Continued) G-135 INFORMATION Residence last five years (Street and Number, RFD, etc.) (City, State and Country) From To Prior residences, if available Employment last five years (Employer's name and address) Occupation or profession From To Prior occupation (Not included above) Organizations (Include any society, clubs, etc., which now or previously affiliated)
